title: How to Connect the iPod to iTunes

steps.title: Open iTunes.
steps.content: Open iTunes. iTunes has an icon that resembles a music note. It comes pre-installed on Mac. To download and install iTunes for Windows 10, click here to open iTunes in the Windows Store. Then click the blue button that says Get to download and install iTunes.

steps.title: Connect your iPod to your computer.
steps.content: Connect your iPod to your computer. Use a USB cable to connect your iPod to your computer. The iPod icon or the name of your iPod device will display at the upper-left corner of iTunes. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click the iPod icon.
steps.content: Click the iPod icon. It's in the upper-left corner of the iTunes. This displays the contents on your iPod. If iTunes does not automatically recognize your iPod, make sure your iPod is unlocked.

steps.title: Click the content type you want to sync with your iPod.
steps.content: Click the content type you want to sync with your iPod. Content type, including "Music", "Movies", "TV Shows", "Books", and "Photos" are displayed in the sidebar to the left under "Settings".

steps.title: Click the checkbox next to items you want to sync.
steps.content: Click the checkbox next to items you want to sync. This allows you to choose what media files you want to upload to your iPod, instead of uploading your entire library.

steps.title: Click Apply.
steps.content: Click Apply . It's in the lower-right corner of the iTunes library. The syncs the content you selected with your iPod. If syncing doesn't start automatically, click the button that says "Sync". You can only sync your iPod to one iTunes library at a time. If you receive a message that says the iPod is already synced to another library, click Erase and Sync to remove the previous library and sync with the new one.

steps.title: Open iTunes.
steps.content: Open iTunes. iTunes has an icon that resembles a music note. It comes pre-installed on Mac. To download and install iTunes for Windows 10, click here then click the blue button that says Get

steps.title: Connect your iPod to your computer.
steps.content: Connect your iPod to your computer. Use a USB cable to connect your iPod to your computer. The iPod icon or the name of your iPod device will display at the upper-left corner of iTunes.

steps.title: Click the iPod icon.
steps.content: Click the iPod icon. It's in the upper-left corner of the iTunes. This displays the contents on your iPod.

steps.title: Click Summary.
steps.content: Click Summary . It's at the top of the list in the sidebar to the left under "Settings".

steps.title: Click the checkbox next to "Sync with this iPod over Wi-Fi".
steps.content: Click the checkbox next to "Sync with this iPod over Wi-Fi". This allows your device to automatically sync with iTunes over a Wi-Fi connection. If this option is not available, your iPod may not support syncing over Wi-Fi.

steps.title: Click Apply.
steps.content: Click Apply . This applies your the Settings and syncs with your iPod.

steps.title: Open iTunes on your computer.
steps.content: Open iTunes on your computer. iTunes has an icon that resembles a music note. It comes pre-installed on Mac.

steps.title: Connect your iPod to your computer.
steps.content: Connect your iPod to your computer. Use a USB cable to connect to the iPod to the computer. If iTunes recognizes the iPod, no further troubleshooting is needed. If it does not recognize your iPod, continue to the next step.

steps.title: Check for a pop-up on your iPod.
steps.content: Check for a pop-up on your iPod. See if there's a pop-up that asks if you want to trust this computer. If this pop-up appears on your iPod screen when you connect it to a computer, tap Trust on your iPod.

steps.title: Examine the USB cable.
steps.content: Examine the USB cable. Look for signs of physical damage or debris attached to the connector port.

steps.title: Insert the USB cable into a different USB port on your computer.
steps.content: Insert the USB cable into a different USB port on your computer. This can help determine whether the USB port on your computer is defective.

steps.title: Use another USB cable.
steps.content: Use another USB cable. This will determine if the original USB cable is defective.

steps.title: Click Help on Windows, or iTunes on Mac.
steps.content: Click Help on Windows, or iTunes on Mac. It's in the menu bar at the top of iTunes on Windows, or in the menu bar at the top of the screen on Mac.

steps.title: Click Check for updates.
steps.content: Click Check for updates . iTunes will check for and install any new updates. Allow a few minutes for this process to finish. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Restart your computer and iPod.
steps.content: Restart your computer and iPod. After you've updated iTunes, restart both your computer and your iPod. After they both restart, open iTunes and connect your iPod once again and see if it can connect.

steps.title: Contact Apple for support.
steps.content: Contact Apple for support. If all else fails, contact Apple Customer Service. They may be able to help you determine if iTunes is conflicting with other software or if your iPod is defective. The number is 1-800-275-2273 in the US. If you live outside the US, click here to see which number you should call.
